ETYMOLOGY: From Old English wice, wucu. Common Germanic origin (related to Dutch week, German Woche). Ultimately, the seven-day cycle is linked to ancient observation and possibly the Jewish Sabbath.

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A period of seven consecutive days, usually calculated from Sunday to Saturday or Monday to Sunday.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 连续的七天周期，通常从周日到周六或周一到周日计算。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: I will be out of town for the whole of next week.

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The standard working or school days of a week, typically Monday through Friday, excluding the weekend.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一周内用于工作或学习的标准日子，通常指周一到周五，不包括周末。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: It rained hard all through the week, but the weekend was sunny.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 整个工作周都在下大雨，但周末却是晴天。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Lasting for the specified number of weeks.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 持续指定周数的时间长度。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She signed up for a twelve-week online course.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她报名参加了一个为期十二周的在线课程。
